keyMoments.title: Kizaru Arrives at Sabaody Archipelago
keyMoments.description: Admiral Kizaru makes his formal appearance at the Sabaody Archipelago, seeking information about Sentomaru while pirates attempt to flee from him.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the arrival of one of the Navy's most powerful admirals at Sabaody, escalating the crisis to a catastrophic level.
keyMoments.quote: Can you tell me where I can find someone named Sentomaru?

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Pika Pika no Mi Powers
keyMoments.description: Kizaru phases through bullets and unleashes a devastating light-speed kick that topples a mangrove tree.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Admiral Kizaru's Logia-type Devil Fruit abilities in combat.

keyMoments.title: Battles Basil Hawkins
keyMoments.description: Kizaru engages Basil Hawkins in combat, attacking with his light-speed kick while Hawkins uses his straw voodoo dolls to survive.
keyMoments.significance: First major confrontation between an Admiral and a Supernova captain.

abilities.description: Kizaru transforms his leg into light and delivers a devastating kick at light speed that can topple mangrove trees.
As a Logia user, Kizaru can transform into light, making physical attacks phase harmlessly through his body.

reveals.information: Can phase through attacks using Pika Pika no Mi
Can deliver devastating light-speed kicks powerful enough to destroy mangrove trees

keyMoments.title: Predicts Survival Against Kizaru
keyMoments.description: Hawkins uses his fortune-telling abilities to calculate his odds against Kizaru, determining he will not die despite having only 12% success rate and 0% chance in direct combat.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hawkins' unique approach to combat through probability calculation.
keyMoments.quote: Direct combat: 0%. General chance of success: 12%. Chance of successful evasion: 76%. I will not die here today.

keyMoments.title: Uses Straw Man Damage Redirection
keyMoments.description: Hawkins demonstrates his Wara Wara no Mi abilities by using straw voodoo dolls to redirect Kizaru's attacks to other people.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the unique defensive mechanism of Hawkins' Devil Fruit that allows him to survive fatal attacks.

abilities.description: Hawkins creates straw voodoo dolls that redirect any physical damage inflicted upon him to other people connected to the dolls. He can hold up to 10 dolls in his body at once.
Hawkins uses tarot cards to calculate probability percentages for various outcomes in battle.

reveals.information: Can redirect damage using straw voodoo dolls connected to other people
Uses fortune-telling to calculate combat probabilities

keyMoments.title: Muscle Expansion Ability
keyMoments.description: Urouge's muscle mass expands dramatically to match the Pacifista in height and strength, allowing him to land powerful blows before being struck by a laser beam.
keyMoments.significance: First full display of Urouge's unique Devil Fruit power that converts damage into increased size and strength.

abilities.description: Urouge can dramatically increase his muscle mass and size, matching even giants or large cyborgs in stature and gaining proportional strength.

reveals.information: Can expand muscle mass to giant size for increased strength

keyMoments.title: Assists Urouge with Powerful Kick
keyMoments.description: X Drake delivers a strong kick that knocks back the Pacifista, demonstrating his formidable physical strength even without using his Devil Fruit transformation.
keyMoments.significance: Shows X Drake's combat capabilities and establishes temporary alliance between Supernovas.

abilities.description: X Drake possesses exceptional physical strength, capable of knocking back Pacifista units with powerful kicks.

keyMoments.title: Sentomaru's Silhouette Appears
keyMoments.description: A mysterious figure wielding a giant broadaxe is shown waiting for a call, teasing Sentomaru's arrival.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows the arrival of another powerful Marine force that will further complicate the pirates' situation.
